meanings.definition: A room where coats and other outerwear are stored.
meanings.sent1: The coatroom at the party was filled with jackets and scarves.
meanings.sent2: Please hang your coat in the coatroom before entering the theater.
meanings.sent3: The coatroom was so full that it looked like a colorful closet.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a coatroom of memories, each one neatly hung and waiting to be revisited.
meanings.sent5: The coatroom smelled of damp wool and anticipation.

meanings.definition: To check one's coat in a coatroom.
meanings.sent1: I will coatroom my jacket before going into the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: She coatrooms her coat every time she goes to a fancy event.
meanings.sent3: He coatrooms his coat like a gentleman, always with a smile.
meanings.sent4: Coatrooming his jacket was a ritual before stepping into the elegant ballroom.
meanings.sent5: The act of coatrooming symbolized leaving behind the worries of the day.
